articles.title: Friday Meeting for Actions against U.S. and War and for Withdrawal of U.S. Forces Held
Swedish Preparatory Committee Inaugurated
articles.content:
Friday Meeting for Actions against U.S. and War and for Withdrawal of U.S. Forces Held 
    Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- The 83rd Friday meeting against the U.S. and war and for the withdrawal of the U.S. forces was reportedly held in front of the U.S. embassy in Seoul on August 5 under the sponsorship of the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration.
 Speakers said at the meeting that the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula was spawned because the United States introduced nuclear weapons into S. Korea in violation of the Korean Armistice Agreement. In order to settle the nuclear issue the U.S. should drop its hostile policy toward the north and its plan for a preemptive nuclear attack and build confidence for normalizing the relations with the DPRK, they noted.    
 They urged the U.S. to stop giving lip-service to peace but show its will to work for peace in practice.

articles.title: Nigerian Preparatory Committee Formed
articles.content:
Swedish Preparatory Committee Inaugurated 
    Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- An inaugural ceremony of the Swedish preparatory committee for celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea was formed in Malmo on Aug. 3.
 The ceremony elected Richardo Stenbery, chairman of the Swedish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, chairman of the preparatory committee.
 The preparatory committee discussed the issue of organizing colorful functions on the occasion.

articles.title: DPRK Comes First in Country Standings at East Asian Football Championships
articles.content:
Nigerian Preparatory Committee Formed 
    Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- A Nigerian preparatory committee for celebrating the 60th anniversaries of the liberation of Korea and the foundation of the Workers' Party of Korea was inaugurated with due ceremony in Abuja on Aug. 2.
 The ceremony elected M. M. Alhassan, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The preparatory committee set the days from Aug. 2 to Oct. 15 as a period of celebrations. It discussed and decided to organize colorful functions including a meeting, a seminar, a film show, a photo exhibition and others in the period for the purpose of widely introducing the immortal exploits performed by President  Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for progressive mankind and socialist Korea.

articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Italian PM
    Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a message of sympathy to Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi over the August 6  airliner crash above the Mediterranean Sea that claimed tens of Italians. 
 In the message he expressed, on behalf of the DPRK government, deep condolences to the prime minister and, through him, to the victims and bereaved families.    
 Meanwhile, Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to his Italian counterpart Gianfranco Fini.

DPRK Delegation Returns Home from Beijing
    Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- The DPRK delegation headed by Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Kye Gwan came back home today after participating in the six-party talks held in Beijing over the nuclear issue between the DPRK and the U.S.
 It was greeted at the airport by Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Yong Il and officials concerned and Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Wu Donghe and Minister-Councilor of the Russian embassy here Oleg Davydov.
